intro: Julocroton phagedaenicus, commonly known as the African firecracker, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical Africa, characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers. The plant features small, clustered inflorescences called cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a waxy coating. Julocroton phagedaenicus is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
